structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.errors.unexpected_input
structures.documentation:
The {@name UnexpectedInput} {@term error} indicates that the request contained a {@term parameter} or {@term field} whose name is not known by the server.

Every {@term operation} expects {@term parameters} with known names. Some of those {@term parameters} may be (or contain) {@term structures}, and the {@term operation} expects those {@term structures} to contain {@term fields} with known names. If the {@term operation} receives {@term parameters} or {@term fields} with names that is does not expect, this {@term error} may be reported.

This {@term error} can be reported by the API infrastructure for any {@term operation}, but it is specific to the API infrastructure, and should never be reported by the implementation of any {@term operation}.

Examples:

  • A client using stubs generated from the interface specification for version2 of a {@term service} invokes the {@term operation} passing one or more {@term parameters} that were added in version2, but they are communicating with a server that only supports version1 of the {@term service}.
  • A client provides an unexpected {@term parameter} or {@term field} name when invoking the {@term operation} using a dynamic interface (for example REST).

The {@link ArgumentLocations}, {@link FileLocations}, and {@link TransientIndication} {@term structures} are intended as possible values for this {@term field}. {@link com.vmware.vapi.std.DynamicID} may also be useful as a value for this {@term field} (although that is not its primary purpose). Some {@term services} may provide their own specific {@term structures} for use as the value of this {@term field} when reporting {@term errors} from their {@term operations}.

structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.errors.unsupported
structures.documentation:
The {@name Unsupported} {@term error} indicates that the {@term operation} is not supported by the {@term service}.

Examples:

  • Trying to hot-plug a CPU when the current configuration of the VM does not support hot-plugging of CPUs.
  • Trying to change the memory size to a value that is not within the acceptable guest memory bounds supported by the virtual machine's host.

fields.name: messages
fields.documentation:
Stack of one or more localizable messages for human {@term error} consumers.

The message at the top of the stack (first in the list) describes the {@term error} from the perspective of the {@term operation} the client invoked. Each subsequent message in the stack describes the "cause" of the prior message.

fields.name: data
fields.documentation:
Data to facilitate clients responding to the {@term operation} reporting a standard {@term error} to indicating that it was unable to complete successfully.

{@term Operations} may provide data that clients can use when responding to {@term errors}. Since the data that clients need may be specific to the context of the {@term operation} reporting the {@term error}, different {@term operations} that report the same {@term error} may provide different data in the {@term error}. The documentation for each each {@term operation} will describe what, if any, data it provides for each {@term error} it reports. The {@link ArgumentLocations}, {@link FileLocations}, and {@link TransientIndication} {@term structures} are intended as possible values for this {@term field}. {@link com.vmware.vapi.std.DynamicID} may also be useful as a value for this {@term field} (although that is not its primary purpose). Some {@term services} may provide their own specific {@term structures} for use as the value of this {@term field} when reporting {@term errors} from their {@term operations}.

packages.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.interposition
packages.documentation: The {@name com.vmware.vapi.std.interposition} {@term package} provides {@term services} that TODO.

structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.interposition.invocation_request
structures.documentation: Information about an interposed request for operation invocation. All interposers would receive an instance of this structure as an input parameter.

fields.name: service_id
fields.documentation: Fully qualified name of the service which contains the interposed operation. In canonical format. For example org.example.hello.

fields.name: operation_id
fields.documentation: Name of the interposed operation. In canonical format. For example say_hello.

fields.name: operation_input
fields.documentation: Input of the interposed operation.

fields.name: user
fields.documentation: User which started the interposed operation.

fields.name: groups
fields.documentation: Groups of the user who started the interposed operation. Would be empty if there is no authentication information.

structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.interposition.invocation_result
structures.documentation: Information about the result from an interposed operation invocation. All POST interposers will receive an instance of this structure.

values.name: NORMAL_RESULT
values.documentation: Normal invocation result.

values.name: ERROR_RESULT
values.documentation: Error invocation result.

fields.name: result_type
fields.documentation: Type of the invocation result.

fields.name: output
fields.documentation: Normal result value.

fields.name: error
fields.documentation: Error result value.

structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.interposition.security_principal
structures.documentation: VMODL equivalent of com.vmware.vapi.security.PrincipalId.

fields.name: name
fields.documentation: Principal name.

fields.name: domain
fields.documentation: Principal domain.

packages.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection
packages.documentation: The {@link com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection} {@term package} provides {@term services} that expose basic information about the vAPI {@term services} registered with a vAPI provider.

services.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection.operation
services.documentation: The {@link Operation} service provides operations to retrieve information about the operations present in a vAPI service.

structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection.operation.data_definition
structures.documentation: The {@link DataDefinition} structure describes a vAPI data type.

enumerations.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection.operation.data_definition.data_type
enumerations.documentation: The {@link DataType} enumeration provides values representing the data types supported by the vAPI infrastructure.

values.name: BINARY
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a binary type.

values.name: BOOLEAN
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a boolean type. The possible values are True and False equivalent of the language used to invoke this operation.

values.name: DOUBLE
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a double type. It is a 64 bit floating point number.

values.name: DYNAMIC_STRUCTURE
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a dynamic structure. This means, any data of type {@link DataType#STRUCTURE} can be used.

values.name: ERROR
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a specific error type.

values.name: ANY_ERROR
values.documentation: Indicates the value is arbitrary error type. This means, any data of type {@link DataType#ERROR} can be used.

values.name: LIST
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a list data type. Any value of this type can have zero or more elements in the list.

values.name: LONG
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a long data type. It is a 64 bit signed integer number.

values.name: OPAQUE
values.documentation: Indicates the value is an opaque type. This means, data of any {@link DataType} can be used.

values.name: OPTIONAL
values.documentation: Indicates the value is an optional data type. Any value of this type can be null.

values.name: SECRET
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a secret data type. This is used for sensitive information. The server will not log any data of this type and if possible wipe the data from the memory after usage.

values.name: STRING
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a string data type. This is a unicode string.

values.name: STRUCTURE
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a structure data type. A structure has string identifier and a set of fields with corresponding values.

values.name: STRUCTURE_REF
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a structure reference. This is used to break circular dependencies in the type references. This just has a string identifier of the structure. Clients have to maintain a list of structures already visited and use that to resolve this reference.

values.name: VOID
values.documentation: Indicates the value is a void data type.

fields.name: type
fields.documentation: Data type of the value.

fields.name: element_definition
fields.documentation: Contains the element definition for generic data types like List and Optional.

fields.name: name
fields.documentation: Fully qualified name of the structure.

fields.name: fields
fields.documentation: Fields of the structure type. The key of the map is the canonical name of the field and the value is the {@link DataDefinition} for the field. The order of the structure fields defined in IDL is not maintained by the {@link Operation} service.

structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection.operation.info
structures.documentation: Information about a vAPI operation.

fields.name: input_definition
fields.documentation:
{@link DataDefinition} describing the operation input.

The {@link DataDefinition#type} of this field will be {@link DataDefinition.DataType#STRUCTURE}. The keys of {@link DataDefinition#fields} are the names of the operation parameters, and the values of {@link DataDefinition#fields} describe the type of the operation parameters.

fields.name: output_definition
fields.documentation: {@link DataDefinition} describing the operation output.

fields.name: error_definitions
fields.documentation:
List of {@link DataDefinition} describing the errors that the operation might report.

The {@link DataDefinition#type} of every element in this list will be {@link DataDefinition.DataType#ERROR}.

operations.name: list
operations.documentation: Returns the set of operation identifiers for a given vAPI service.

result.documentation: set of operation identifiers for a given vAPI service.

errors.documentation: If the service identifier does not exist.

operations.name: get
operations.documentation: Returns the {@link Info} for a given vAPI operation.

result.documentation: {@link Info} for a given vAPI operation.

errors.documentation: If the operation identifier does not exist.

services.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection.provider
services.documentation: The {@link Provider} service provides operations to retrieve information about a vAPI Provider. A provider is a container that exposes one or more vAPI services.

structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection.provider.info
structures.documentation: Information about a vAPI provider

fields.name: id
fields.documentation: Identifier of the provider

fields.name: checksum
fields.documentation:
Checksum of the information present in the provider.

Clients can use this information to check if the service information has changed. When a new service is added or removed (or) one of the existing service information is modified, the value of the checksum changes.

The information used to calculate the checksum includes:

  • service identifiers
  • operation identifiers inside the service
  • input, output and error definitions of an operation

operations.name: get
operations.documentation: Returns a {@link Info} describing the vAPI provider on which the operation is invoked

result.documentation: {@link Info} describing the vAPI provider on which the operation is invoked

services.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection.service
services.documentation: The {@link Service} service provides operations to retrieve information about the services exposed by a vAPI provider. A provider is a container that exposes one or more vAPI services.

structures.name: com.vmware.vapi.std.introspection.service.info
structures.documentation: Information about a vAPI service

fields.name: operations
fields.documentation: Set of identifiers of operations present in the service

operations.name: list
operations.documentation: Returns the set of service identifiers.

result.documentation: set of service identifiers

operations.name: get
operations.documentation: Returns the {@link Info} for the specified service

result.documentation: {@link Info} for the specified service

errors.documentation: If the service identifier does not exist
